intro: Microstachys marginata, commonly known as the marginate microstachys, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often slightly hairy. The plant produces small, clustered spikelets that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers, which are typically greenish or pale in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Microstachys marginata is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
